# dynmethods
This package contains wrappers for all of the trajectory inference methods included in the [dynverse](https://www.github.com/dynverse/dynverse) review. 
These wrappers contain code to translate the data structures produced by any of the methods to the common trajectory model (Fig. 1b in [manuscript](https://www.biorxiv.org/content/early/2018/03/05/276907)). 
There are several common post-processing functions provided by the [dynwrap](https://www.github.com/dynverse/dynwrap) package 
(Supp. Fig. 19b in [manuscript](https://www.biorxiv.org/content/early/2018/03/05/276907)), which the different wrappers are allowed to make use of.

Currently implemented are the following wrappers:

```{r, echo = FALSE, warning = FALSE, error = FALSE, message = FALSE, results='asis'}
library(tidyverse)
library(dynmethods)

df <- list.files("R", pattern = "ti_", full.names = T) %>% 
  map_df(function(file) {
    file_text <- readr::read_lines(file)
    
    line_numbers <- which(str_detect(file_text, "^ti_[ a-zA-Z]*<-"))
    descr_funs <- str_replace(file_text[line_numbers], "(ti_[a-zA-Z]*) <-.*", "\\1")
    ti_methods <- map(descr_funs, ~ do.call(., args = list(), envir = asNamespace("dynmethods")))
    long_names <- map_chr(ti_methods, ~ .$name)
    short_names <- map_chr(ti_methods, ~ .$short_name)
    
    data_frame(
      file, 
      line_number = line_numbers,
      fun_name = descr_funs,
      long_name = long_names,
      short_name = short_names
    )
  }) %>% 
  arrange(long_name) %>% 
  mutate(
    code_label = glue::glue("{file}#L{line_number}"),
    code_url = glue::glue("https://github.com/dynverse/dynmethods/blob/master/{code_label}"),
    Code = glue::glue("[{code_label}]({code_url})"),
    vignette_label = glue::glue("{short_name}.md"),
    vignette_relpath = glue::glue("inst/doc/{vignette_label}"),
    vignette_url = glue::glue("https://github.com/dynverse/dynmethods/blob/master/{vignette_relpath}"),
    Vignette = ifelse(file.exists(vignette_relpath), glue::glue("[{vignette_label}]({vignette_url})"), "")
  )

knitr::kable(df %>% select(Name = long_name, Code, Vignette))

```
